response: Preheat oven to 350. Cream together butter and sugar. Add egg and beat well. Add coffee granules and mix well. Stir in flour. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto greased cookie sheets. Bake 10 minutes. Cool. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Cut in half diagonally. Drizzle over top of each bar one tablespoon milk. Drop almonds onto bars. Frost bars with remaining milk. Spread over top. Makes 30 bars.

In a large skillet, saute celery, onion and mushrooms in butter. Mix bread cubes and sausage together. Add mixture to vegetables and stir in broth. Cook uncovered over medium heat until heated through. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Combine stuffing with sage. Turn out into a greased 1 1/2 quart baking dish. Bake in a 350f oven for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. To make stuffing, mix bread cubes, swiss cheese, dry onion, eggs and milk together. Add seasonings to taste. Spoon mixture into a greased 9 x 13 casserole dish. Bake for 30 minutes. To make ring, cut bread into 1/8th inch slices. Spray with cooking spray to prevent sticking. Cut slices into rings using a pizza cutter. Place one ring atop each other to form the ring. Place 1 teaspoon turkey on the bottom of the ring and top with one slice of swiss cheese. Add another ring of bread to the top of the cheese slice and top with turkey slices. Add another slice of bread to the top of the turkey ring and top with another slice of swiss cheese. Add another slice of bread to the top of the cheese slice and top with turkey slices. Repeat to form the ring with 8 rings of bread with turkey slices on top. Refrigerate for 2 hours prior to baking to set the ring. Place turkey

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and place in a large bowl. Add broccoli and peanut buttertoss gently to coat. Add peanut oil and garlic and toss to coat. Add soy sauce and rice vinegartoss to coat. Drizzle with sesame oil and sprinkle with crushed red pepper. Serve immediately.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water. Mix macaroni with mayo, salt and pepper and about half of the breadcrumbs. Refrigerate for about 20 minutes. Stir in the remaining breadcrumbs. Serve with a salad or veggies.

Brown sausage and bacon in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and sausage mixture. Cook until onions are tender and sausage is done. Drain and reserve. Cook and drain frozen mixed vegetables in microwave or on stove. Place in a 13 x 9 baking dish. Add reserved sausage mixture and soup mix. Mix well. Pour into a baking dish. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

Spread the white bread slices lightly with the crunchy peanut butter. Top each slice with a layer of the whole wheat bread. Spread each slice lightly with jelly. Top each sandwich with a goldfish cracker. Place the sandwiches on a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 425f for about 6 minutes or until the bread is golden. Serve immediately.

In a shallow dish combine flour with soy sauce and sugar. Dip each piece of chicken into the flour mixture. In a nonstick skillet, saute chicken in oil until lightly browned. Add pineapple and parsley. Saute 2 minutes. Transfer to a serving platter. Serve with rice and parsley sprigs.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) and line a baking sheet. Mix butter and sugars until creamy. Add eggs and vanilla. Sift flour, baking soda and salt into the mixture. Stir in water. Fold in chocolate chips. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto the prepared baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes.
Add cherries to glass, then grapefruit. Pour ruby red grapefruit juice over grapefruit. Add vodka and fill glass with ice. Garnish with lime wedge.

Boil water and sugar in a saucepan until sugar is dissolved. Add juice and flavoring. Continue boiling until thickened. Remove from heat. Add lemon juice and spices. Pour into a pitcher and refrigerate.

Beat eggs with milk in bowl or measuring cup until well blended. Heat butter in nonstick skillet over medium heat until meltedstir in green onionscook 2 minutes or until onions are crisp tender. Stir in jalapeño pepper, salt and peppercook 30 seconds or until jalapeño begins to soften. Pour egg mixture into skilletcook 2 minutes or until eggs set around edges but are soft in center. Sprinkle with cheesecover skillet. Cook 1 minute longer or until cheese is melted and eggs are set. Serve immediately with warm tortillas for dipping or scooping the eggs with.

Combine all the berries and ginger ale in a blender until smooth. Pour into a large pitcher or bowl. Stir in milk, vanilla and sugar. Pour into ice cube trays. Freeze until firm. Serve with a dollop of sour cream in each glass. Refrigerate any leftovers. This is a good recipe for a summer party. It makes about 8-10 servings.

Bring orange juice to a boil in a small saucepan. Add hoisin sauce and boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in honey. Taste and adjust sweetness and thickness. Pour over salmon fillets and let marinate in the fridge for 15 minutes. Grill or broil as desired.

In a food processor puree roasted red peppers until smooth. Add remaining pesto ingredients except almonds. Process until smooth. Reserve about 1/4 cup mixture for garnish. Mix almonds with remaining pesto mixture. Thread chicken on skewers. Grill over medium-high heat, turning frequently until done (about 8-10 minutes). Serve with extra pesto mixture for dipping. Garnish with chopped cilantro leaves.

Preheat grill to medium-high temperature. In a small bowl, combine blue cheese with lemon juice, salt and pepper until smooth. In a small saucepan over medium-low heat melt butteradd basil, garlic cloves. Stir until garlic is fragrant. Remove from heatset aside until ready to use. Prepare vegetables as directed. Grill vegetables over direct heat until tender-crispremove from grill. Brush vegetables with olive oilsprinkle with salt and pepper. Arrange vegetables on a plattertop with cheese mixture, blue cheese mixture over vegetablesdrizzle with olive oil mixture. Sprinkle with remaining blue cheesegarnish with fresh basil, if desired.

Melt the butter in a 10 inch skillet over medium heat. Add the sliced garlic and saute until tender. Sprinkle the pork with salt and pepper and place it in the skillet. Cook it over medium high heat until brown and crispy. Sprinkle it with the garlic and pepper mixture. Transfer it to a plate and set aside. Add the onions and saute them until they are soft and translucent. Add the olive oil and saute the onions until they are translucent. Add the pork back to the skillet with the garlic. Add the wine and bring it to a boil. Pour in the juice from the can of tomatoes. Reduce the heat to low and simmer. When the pork is tender and the juices run clear when pierced with a knife, remove it from the heat and cut it into thin slices. Serve the pork with the juices.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a medium saucepan, combine pears, pumpkin puree, figs, brown sugar, cinnamon and water over medium heatbring to a boil, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat to lowsimmer 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Pour filling into prepared pie crust. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes in the preheated oven until filling is bubbly around the edges. Let cool 15 minutes before serving. Makes 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 325. In a small sauce pan melt butter and brown sugar. Cook until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat and cool to lukewarm. In a large bowl cream together butter and brown sugar. Add in flour and mix to combine. Add in graham cracker crumbs and mix. Press mixture into the bottom of an 8 or 9 inch square pan. Bake at 325 for 15-20 minutes. In a large skillet melt the chocolate chips and marshmallows stirring to make sure the chips melt completely. Pour melted chocolate mixture over baked crust. Sprinkle with chopped walnuts. Return to the oven and bake for 5-10 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool completely. Lift off the pan. Serve with extra marshmallows and graham crackers.

Preheat oven to 250 degrees. In a large bowl stir together the oats, almonds and wheat germ. In a saucepan heat honey and cinnamon over medium heat until honey is completely melted and blended with the cinnamon. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla. Pour over dry ingredients and stir until evenly coated. Spread mixture out on a cookie sheet. Bake 1 hour. Stir granola every 15 minutes. Cool completely. Store in an airtight container. This is great with yogurt and fresh fruit. You can also substitute a different fruit for the dried fruit.

Peel the oranges. Cut them into eight slices each. Place the slices in a shallow dish, cover with the caster sugar and the whole vanilla bean and then pour over the liqueur. Leave for about 3 hours until the syrup is absorbed. Remove the skin by gently rubbing it off the slices with a knife. Dust with some caster sugar and serve with a little brandy.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a small bowl mix together 1/2 cup margarine and 1/2 cup sugar. In large bowl beat eggs and add to sugar mixture. Add in vanilla extract and cocoa powder. In another bowl mix together flour and nuts. Add to wet mixture and mix well. Pour into greased 13x9 inch baking dish. Mix together the remaining 1/2 cup of margarine and 1/2 cup of sugar. Stir in 1/2 cup of mini chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoon onto the brownies. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and cool. Sprinkle remaining mini chocolate chips on top and serve.

In a large bowl beat butter and sugar substitute until fluffy. Add pineapple and eggs. In a separate bowl sift together flour, whole wheat flour and baking soda. Gradually add to butter mixture. Stir in vanilla. Pour into greased loaf pan and bake at 350 for 1 hour and 5 minutes. Cool before slicing and serving.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9 x 13-inch pan. Sift together flour, cocoa powder and salt into a small bowl and set aside. Beat the butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Add brown sugar and beat until light and fluffy. Add eggs and vanilla and beat until well blended. Reduce mixer speed and add flour mixture. Beat until just blended. Gently fold in chocolate chips. Pour into prepared pan and smooth top with a knife. Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes. Allow the brownies to cool completely in the pan. Then cut into bars and store in an airtight container for up to one week.

Prepare broccoli and place in large bowl. Chop bacon into small pieces. Melt butter in large saucepan. Add onion. Sauté until tender. Add vinegar, sugar, mustard, salt and pepper. Stir in broccoli. Mix in bacon and cheese. Cool slightly. Chill. Serve with crackers.
Mix bacardi limon with lemonade in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Pour into a tall glass filled with ice. Top with lemon juice and lime juice. Garnish with lime wedge.

Put one half of the berries in the bottom of a large pitcher. Put half of the jelly in the pitcher. Pour over one half of the port wine. Repeat layering with the remaining berries, jelly and port. Stir to combine. Let the mixture sit for 1 hour. Pour into pitcher. Cover and chill. Serve over ice.
Blend mangoes and orange juice together in a blender. Stir in club soda and lime juice. Serve over ice cubes.
In a large bowl combine all ingredients. Stir until mixed thoroughly. Store in an air tight container. Makes 24 servings.

Preheat the griddle or pan over medium heat. In a large bowl, combine the cornmeal, flour, baking powder and salt. In a smaller bowl, combine the eggs and beer. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients and stir until all of the dry ingredients are moistened. Add the onion and jalapeno to the mixture and stir. Use the back of a spoon to make the mixture into 4-inch balls. Place the balls onto the hot griddle. Cook for about 4 minutes, until the tops are golden brown. Flip the hush puppies over and cook for 2 minutes longer. Drizzle the hush puppies with melted butter and serve hot.

Slice challah horizontally. Spread butter on one half. Place tomatoes and basil leafs on the other half. Add brie. Put halves together and press them together. Place a plate on top of the sandwich and put it into the freezer for 15 minutes. Remove the plate and gently press the sandwich together again. Serve cold.

Mix together vinegar, oil and lemon juice and pour over chops. Let stand for at least 1 hour at room temperature. Sprinkle with rosemary and salt and pepper. Grill or broil. (If using lamb chops, broil for 15 minutes.) Serve with mashed potatoes.

Trim squash ends with a vegetable peeler. Cut squash crosswise into 1-inch thick slices. In a small bowl, combine chicken broth with 1 teaspoon salt. Set aside. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat oil until hot but not smoking. Add half of the garlic cloves to the skilletcook until golden brown, about 30 seconds. Remove garlic cloves with a slotted spoon and transfer to paper towels to drain. Repeat with the remaining garlic cloves. Return skillet to medium-high heat. Add the squash slices and cook until lightly golden brown on both sides, about 3 to 4 minutes per side. Meanwhile, pour the reserved broth into a small bowlstir in the lime juice and dried oregano. Pour the broth mixture over the squash slices. Sprinkle the squash with the remaining 1 teaspoon salt and black peppergarnish with the parsley sprigs. Serve immediately with the reserved garlic cloves for dipping.

Melt sugar and olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat until sugar dissolves. Add mustard and garlic powder and stir until combined. Whisk in mayonnaise and prepared mustard. Remove from heat and stir in dill weed. Serve with pretzel sticks.

Roast pears until tender and lightly carmelized (150 degrees in a water bath). Wrap each pear in a slice of bacon. Place pears in a baking pan lined with foil. Roast pears until bacon is crisp (300 degrees). Meanwhile, prepare a simple vinaigrette of red wine vinegar (1 part), Dijon mustard (1 part), honey (1 part) and olive oil (5 parts). Combine in a jar with a lid and shake well until emulsified. Toss salad greens with vinaigrette. Arrange pears and bacon alongside greens on serving plate. Sprinkle with pecans and grated cheese. Serve immediately or within a few days of the original preparation date. Store any leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a week or in the freezer for up to 3 months.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Bake the white bread (10 slices) for 10 minutes until it is crispy, then cool. Cut each slice of white bread into four triangles. Place 1 cup of bacon in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook the bacon until it is crisp, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and drain on paper towels to cool. Crumble into small bits. Mix together the bacon, eggs, milk, salt and pepper into a bowl. Place half of the bacon mixture on each of the white bread triangles. Sprinkle with some of the jalapeno jack cheese and a little bit of the cheddar cheese. Place a second piece of white bread on top of each of the sandwiches. Place in a greased 9x13 casserole dish or on a baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes or until the sandwiches are golden brown. Serve hot or cold.

Season fillets with salt and pepper. Heat a little oil and fry the fish until done. Remove and set aside. Add a little oil to the pan and fry the scallops until done. Set aside. Heat the remainder of the oil and stir-fry the green peppercorns until they are slightly brown. Add the green peppercorns to the fish and scallops. Stir in lemon juice and pour in the butter. Mix well and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In large bowl, cream butter with sugars and eggs for 2 minutes. Beat in vanilla extract and egg yolksstir in flour mixture just until combined (dough will be soft). Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets 2 inches apart. Bake for 9 to 11 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool for 2 minutes on baking sheets then remove to wire racks to cool completely.

Mix graham cracker crust and sugar until blended. Press into the bottom of an ungreased pie plate. Mix cream cheese and frozen dessert topping until blended. Spread over crust. Arrange cherries over cheesecake mixture and drizzle with a little of the frozen dessert mixture. Cover with plastic wrap and place in freezer for about an hour. To serve, remove from freezer and let stand for about 15 minutes. Serve with whipped cream. Makes 8 servings.

In a medium saucepan bring the water and chicken bouillon powder to a boil. Add the butter and let the butter melt completely. Add the orzo and cook until al dente. Remove from heat and stir in the rice and lemon juice. Serve with a mixture of butter and garlic powder and onion powder.
In a large bowl combine all the coleslaw ingredients. Toss with a large spoon until combined. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve with your favorite grilled meats.

Cut sweet potatoes into wedges. Toss with oil and salt, and place in an oiled baking dish. Bake at 375 degrees f for 40 minutes or until tender. Meanwhile, make a simple glaze by combining soy sauce, brown sugar and mirin and simmering them together over low heat until reduced to half. Brush glaze over sweet potatoes while still warm and sprinkle with sesame seeds before serving.

Heat the oil and garlic in a large heavy saucepan over moderately low heat for 2 minutes. Add the wine and the clams. Cook until the clams have opened. Discard any that remain closed. Raise the heat to moderately high and cook until the wine has evaporated. Add the cherry tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes. Add the parsley and the lemon juice and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the butter and season with salt and pepper. Serve on toasted bread.

Prepare the spice mixture by combining the flour, salt, celery salt, pepper and paprika and blending them together. Add the canola oil to a deep fryer or a heavy pot and heat to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Dip the chicken pieces first into the seasoned flour then the egg and then the seasoned flour again. Fry the pieces until golden brown and crisp and serve immediately with the sauce of your choice. (Makes about 5 pieces)

Peel pears- cut off stem ends. Core pears- slice pears into wedges- arrange pears in a 2-quart baking pan. Sprinkle with raisins and drizzle with maple syrup- add butter. Sprinkle with cinnamon- sprinkle with vanilla extract- cover pan with foil- place pan in 350-degree oven for 45 minutes - uncover pan for last 5 minutes. Serve hot with ice cream- if desired.

Peel carrots and place in a large saucepan with water to cover. Bring to a boil over high heat and cook until tender. Drain carrots and set aside. In the same saucepan heat oil over medium heat. Add garlic and sauté until golden. Add carrots and thyme. Pour stock over carrots and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about 20 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Mash carrots with a fork or an emulsion blender. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl combine cream cheese and sugar. Stir in egg and flour. Spoon 1/2 teaspoon of cream cheese mixture onto each biscuit and fold over. Place on a baking sheet. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 5 minutes. Serve warm.

Cut up potatoes to fit inside of your foil pouches. Place them inside of the foil pouches with the onion slices and drizzle olive oil over them and sprinkle taco seasoning on top as well. Fold up the foil pouches and place them directly on the griddle for about 15 minutes on each side.
Cook oats according to package instructions. In a separate bowl, mix milk and cinnamon. Add oats to milk mixture and stir. Add banana slices. Chill in refrigerator for a few hours. Serve.

In a large skillet over medium heat, add oil. Saute onion and ground turkey until no longer pink. Add cumin seed, tomatoes with juice, beans with juice, sazon goya, salt, black pepper, and red chili powder. Stir until well blended. Add more salt if desired.

Bring potatoes and milk to a boil in a large pot over medium heat. Reduce heatcover and simmer until tender when pierced with a fork, about 15 minutes. Drain potatoes and return them to the pot with the sour cream and chivesmash potatoes lightly with a potato masher. Stir in the cheese and corn flakes and cook over low heat until cheese is melted and potatoes are hot throughout. Transfer potatoes and cheese mixture to a 9-inch square baking dishsprinkle with salt and pepper. Let cool until just warm before serving.

Bring 4 cups water to a boil in a 2-quart saucepan and add salt and bay leaves. Gradually add lentilsreturn to a boil and cook, uncovered, 15 to 20 minutes or until tender. Drain well and set aside. Meanwhile, place onion in a large bowl and toss with olive oil and orange zestseason with salt and pepper to taste. Arrange lentils in a shallow 2-quart baking dish in a single layer and sprinkle with orange juice. Spoon onion mixture over lentils and drizzle with olive oil and orange juice. Bake until golden and tender, about 45 minutes. Serve hot or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cream butter and sugar together. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Combine dry ingredients in a large bowl. Stir dry ingredients into the creamed mixture and add vanilla and extracts. Add walnuts and chocolate chips. Pour into a greased 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 to 45 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan. Makes 16 bars.

Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in onion until softened. Add enchilada sauce and stir for about 1 minute. Stir in chili without beans. Layer 6 enchiladas in a 13-by-9-inch baking dish. Pour sauce over enchiladas. Top with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

Boil carrots and potatoes until just tender. Brown hamburger and drain. Add olive oil to frying pan. Add carrots and potatoes to pan and stir. Add soup mix and stir. Add hamburger to pan and stir. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve over foil and let carrots and potatoes heat up.

Preheat a large skillet over medium heat. Add bacon and saute until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Add green onion and saute 2 minutes. Add cream and seasoning salt to bacon mixture. Pour into a 10 inch oven-safe skillet. Add the eggs and let them stand for 2-3 minutes to thicken. Pour over the bacon mixture and fold together. Sprinkle cheese evenly over the omelet. Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until eggs are set. Slice and serve hot.
Melt butter and sugar. Add eggs. Stir well. Add flour. Blend well. Mix in chocolate chips. Pour into greased 9 x 13 glass dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Cool.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook pasta in boiling salted water for about 10 minutes or until tender but firm to the bite. Drain pasta well and set aside. Meanwhile, bring large pot of water to a boil. Add potatoes to boiling water, cooking them until tender but firm to the bite. Drain well. Add pasta back to pot and add potatoes to pasta. Add in french style green beans. Toss pasta mixture together well. Pour in pesto sauce and toss again to coat well. Serve immediately.

Prepare macaroni according to directions on box. Drain and place in greased 2 quart casserole dish. In large bowl, combine flour and next 5 ingredientsstir well. Add egg and milk to dry mixturestir until smooth. Spoon mixture over macaroni and sprinkle cheese on top of casserole. Bake at 350 degrees for 25-30 minutes until cheese is melted and casserole is light golden brown.

Heat a large stock pot over medium heat and add the oil. Add the ground beef and cook until brown, stirring frequently with a wooden spoon, then add the diced carrots and potatoes and cook for another minute until the vegetables are tender. Stir in the corn, tomatoes and water and bring the mixture to a boil, then lower the heat and simmer until the vegetables are tender and the beef is very tender, about 50 minutes. Add the bouillon cubes and cook until they dissolve, then season with salt and pepper and stir in the garlic. Serve hot with a dollop of sour cream on top if desired.
Put all the ingredients except the rice in large pot and bring to a boil. Add rice. Stir to make sure the rice is covered. Cook for 45 minutes or until rice is done.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to boil over high heatcook the spaghetti according to package directionsdrain and set aside in a bowl. Meanwhile, cook bacon in a heavy large saucepan over moderately high heat, stirring frequently, until crisptransfer bacon to paper towels to drain. Add the onion, garlic, and butter to the saucepan and cook over moderate heat until softened, about 5 minutesstir in the flour and cook for 3 minutes. Whisk in the milk, bring to a boil, and cook until thickened slightly, about 3 minutes. Add the cream and cook until the sauce is smooth and thickened, about 3 minutes. Stir in the pasta, bacon and peasseason the pasta sauce with salt and pepper, top each serving with the ricotta, parsley and Parmesan cheese and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Heat the olive oil in a large oven proof pot. Add the onions and cook until tender. Add the thighs and cook for about 8 minutes or until browned. Add the parsnips. Cook for about 10 more minutes or until parsnips are soft. Add the broth. Increase heat to medium and bring to a boil. Stir in the mustard and honey. Season the mixture with the thyme and parsley. Bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer. Cook for about 45-50 minutes or until the meat is tender and the liquid has thickened. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add milk and vanilla. Add dry ingredients to creamed mixture. Stir until well blended. Stir in nuts and chocolate. Drop by rounded tablespoon onto lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake 12 to 15 minutes or until firm to touch. Cool for 3 to 4 minutes before removing from cookie sheet. Remove to wire rack to cool completely.

Muddle the rum with the brandy and the triple sec. Add the ice cubes and orange juice to the shaker. Shake and strain into a highball glass filled with ice cubes and the pineapple juice and the grenadine. Top with the rum and brandy mixture and serve.

Peel and cut carrots into 1/2-inch rounds. In a 2-quart saucepan over medium-high heat, melt butter. Add carrots. Cook for 5 minutes. Add sugar, cider and stock. Cook until carrots are tender-crisp. Stir in mustard. Cook 1 minute. Serve hot. Garnish with parsley.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Heat oil in large skillet over medium high heat. Add onion and saute 3 minutes. Add sliced mushrooms and cook 2 minutes. Add red peppers and cook 3 minutes or until tender. Stir in remaining ingredients. Pour into an 8x8x2 inch baking dish. Bake 20 minutes or until heated through and bubbly. Serve over cooked pasta.
Bake in a greased casserole dish at 350F for 1 hour. Or, bake miniature party rye rounds until cheese melts and is bubbly. Top with sauce.

Preheat oven to 375f. Slice eggplant lengthwise. Arrange slices in a 9x13 casserole dish. Sprinkle eggplant with a little olive oil. Roast 30 to 40 minutes. Meanwhile, saute onions in oil until soft. Stir in roasted tomatoes. Spoon some of mixture over eggplant. Sprinkle with basil. Sprinkle with feta cheese. Repeat with remaining eggplant. Roast 15 minutes more. Serve warm.

Dip chicken strips into mustard mixture. Place 2 teaspoons of mustard mixture into the center of each tortilla. Roll up tortilla with chicken. Place on plate and cover with nuts and cheese. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes until cheese melts. Serve with crackers or potato chips.
Tear off pieces of tortillas into small triangular pieces, dip them into the beans and fry them in oil until crisp. Serve with refried beans and cheese, sour cream, taco seasoning, and taco sauce.

In a large skillet brown carrots and onions in butter over medium heat for about 3 minutes or until tender. Remove from heat and stir in mayonnaise and water. Add prepared horseradish and pepper to taste. Stir in dry breadcrumbs. Pour into an unbaked pie shell. Top with cheese. Bake at 375 for 25 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Mix butter, cheese and worcestershire sauce together with a hand mixer. Mix the flour, rice krispies and tabasco together to make a crumb mixture. Roll out the dough into small balls. Roll each ball in the crumb mixture to coat thoroughly. Place cookies on a greased baking sheet and bake for about 10 minutes or until done. Serve warm with marmite or any other dipping sauces you can think of!

Bring 4 cups of water to a boil. Add 1 tablespoon of salt and 1/2 teaspoon of pepper to the boiling water. Add the pasta and cook for 2 minutes or so. Drain the pasta and then add 2 tablespoons of olive oil to the pan and heat on medium-high heat for 30 seconds. Add the garlic and stir constantly for 30 seconds or so until it starts to color a bit and smell like garlic. Add the basil leaves to the pan and cook for 30 seconds more. Add the tomatoes to the pan and cook for another 2 minutes stirring occasionally. Add the avocado to the pan and cook for 1 minute more stirring occasionally. Add the pasta and toss with the cooked vegetables and the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil for 2 minutes more or so. Season with salt and pepper to taste and garnish with basil leaves and crushed red pepper flakes if you like. Serve immediately with fresh bread and a salad for an easy meal on any day of the week.

Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Dip orange roughy fillets in butter and place in skillet. Cook for about 5 minutes on each side. Sprinkle with dijon mustard and worcestershire sauce. Top with crumbs and parsley and serve with lemon wedges.

Combine carrots in a steamer basket. Place basket in a medium sized pot. Cover with an inch of water. Steam carrots until tender. Drain. Combine carrots with lemon juice and orange juice in a large bowl. Add carrot mixture to a medium sized pot. Combine remaining ingredients. Whisk into carrots. Bring to a boil. Boil for 3 minutes. Pour carrots into a lightly greased 9 x 13 casserole dish. Allow to cool. Refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight. Serve. Store in refrigerator.

Wash potatoes and dry well. Prick with a fork and place in a large pot of cold water. Bring to a boil and add enough water to cover by 1 inch. Bring to a boil again and then simmer for 20 minutes or until tender. Drain and cool. Slice potatoes in half. Put back in pot and add 4 tablespoons of butter. Mash slightly with a potato masher. Stir in remaining butter and seasonings and mash some more. Mix in peas and serve.

Add 1/2 cup milk and 1/2 cup sour cream to a saucepan. Heat over medium heat. Add flour and 1 tsp. pepper. Whisk to combine. Add jimmy dean sausage and cook for 1-2 minutes. Remove from heat. Add butter and stir until melted. Serve over scrambled eggs.

In a large bowl cream butter and sugar. Add egg and beat well. Sift together flour and baking powder and add to butter mixture. Mix until smooth. Add vanilla and stir until well blended. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350F for 7-10 minutes. Cool cookies slightly. Dip each cookie in melted chocolate confectionary coating. Place on wax paper and sprinkle with chopped nuts.

Boil water in kettle. Add tea bags. Allow to steep until tea is very strong. Remove bags. Add orange juice. Add sugar to taste. Add cranberry juice to taste. Add lemon juice to taste. Add water to make two quarts. Serve hot.

Peel potatoes and cut them into large chunks. Toss with a little coarse salt and place on a large baking sheet. Drizzle with melted butter and bake for about an hour and a half at 425 degrees f. Flip the chips over after about an hour and sprinkle with more coarse salt. Return them to the oven for another half hour. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with cajun seasoning. Serve warm.

Wrap fresh asparagus with bacon. In a small bowl combine worcestershire sauce and brown sugar. Brush mixture over asparagus. Place on a cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Drizzle with melted butter. Sprinkle with fresh garlic.

Combine sugar, corn syrup and milk in a saucepan over medium heat, stirring occasionally until sugar is dissolved. Bring to a boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in chocolate. Whisk in butter until smooth and thickened, then cool for about 5 minutes. Whisk in the vanilla extract until combined. Use immediately to frost cupcakes or cake, or store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. To re-soften frosting, warm in the microwave at 30-second intervals, stirring until smooth.

Boil raisins in water until softened. Drain raisins and reserve water. Heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic clove and cook for 1 minute. Add spinach and cook until wilted. Add raisins. Drain any excess water. Add salt & pepper. Add pine nuts and cook for 1 minute. Serve immediately.
Mix together until frothy. Makes one shake.

Cut potatoes into large chunks. Boil 10 minutes or until tender. Drain well. Place potatoes in a baking dish. Top with ham, soup and cheese. Bake 15 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. Grease 12 muffin cups in a standard muffin pan with oil or cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine flour, blue cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, salt and mix thoroughly. In another bowl, whisk together buttermilk, egg, oil, butter and mix until blended. Add the wet mixture to the flour mixture all at once, stirring until just blended. Fold in bacon bits and jalapenos. Fill muffin cups about 2/3 of the way full and bake for 20 minutes. Let muffins cool in pan for 5 minutes before removing them from the pan.

Prepare bread crumbs. Slice eggplant lengthwise into 1/4 inch slices. Lightly sprinkle each slice with celery salt and parmesan cheese. Roll each slice in bread crumbs until completely coated. Heat 1/4 inch of oil in a frying pan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Fry eggplant in batches until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve with a side salad.

Drain sun-dried tomatoes. Chop into small pieces. Heat a little olive oil in a pan. Add the garlic and stir for about a minute until fragrant. Add the sun-dried tomatoes. Add the crushed tomatoes. Add a dash of sugar. Add the olives. Add the basil. Add the cheeses. Add the pasta. Cook until the pasta is al dente.

Combine marmalade with soy sauce and garlic cloves in a bowl and stir to mix thoroughly. Place salmon fillets into a shallow baking dish and pour over marmalade mixture. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or up to overnight. Preheat broiler and place fillets on rack. Broil fillets for 5-7 minutes or until center is firm but flakes easily with a fork. Serve immediately with rice or pasta and your favorite vegetables.

Trim sweetbreads of excess fat and membrane. Slice into 1/2 inch thick pieces. Dip sweetbreads first in vinegar then in flour. Dip each piece of sweetbread into the melted bacon fat. Then into the egg and then into the flour again. Place in heated frying pan. Brown on one side then flip and brown other side. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Remove from pan and add to hot pan the garlic powder and butter and cook until the butter is melted. Add the oil and let the sweetbreads saute for 30 seconds. Serve hot.

Combine the maple syrup, apple juice, nutmeg, cinnamon, and brown rice. Place pork chops in a shallow baking dish. Pour over the brown rice mixture. Cover with foil. Bake in a preheated 350 degree F (175 degree C) oven for 30 minutes. Add squash and apples. Cover with foil. Bake for 30 minutes more or until the meat is cooked through.

Saute red bell pepper in butter over medium heat for 5 minutes. Stir in ham and cook an additional 5 minutes. Meanwhile, in a medium bowl whisk eggs and heavy cream. Season with salt and pepper to taste. When ham is done add it to the bowl and stir in the eggs and cream mixture. Add the chili powder and stir to combine. Cook for 1-2 minutes or until egg mixture begins to thicken. Add the garlic powder and stir to combine. Remove from heat. Add cheddar and stir until melted. To serve, gently fold in the scrambled eggs. Serve with toast and enjoy!

Preheat the oven to 200°C/Gas Mark 6. Melt the butter and sugar together in a saucepan. Once the butter has melted and the sugar is dissolved add in the syrup and honey. Bring to the boil and cook until the syrup has thickened slightly. Add the oats and stir until coated. Spoon onto a baking tray and place in the middle of the oven for 10-15 minutes. Keep an eye on them as they will brown quickly. When ready to serve, place a knife or spoon down the centre of each pancake and turn it over. Serve straight away.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Prepare sugar cookie mix as directed on package for cookies. Add egg to cookie mix and beat on low speed for 30 seconds. Stir in oil until moistened. Add water and mix well. Drop by teaspoonful onto greased baking sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until set. Cool slightly before removing to cooling rack to cool completely. Cream cheese frosting: In large bowl with mixer, beat cream cheese with butter until blended. Add vanilla and sugar-free raspberry jambeat on low speed until well blended. Frost bars while still warm.

In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar and baking powder. Add salt and baking soda and stir. Cut in butter with pastry blender until mixture resembles small crumbs. Make a well in the center of the mixture. Add egg and orange juice and stir until just combined. Fold in orange peel and cranberries. Transfer to greased loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees F for 1 hour or until light brown and tester inserted in center comes out clean. Let bread cool in pan for about 10 minutes before removing from pan. Cool on wire rack.

Melt the semi-sweet chocolate and coconut oil and stir until smooth. Set aside to cool and thicken. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix together cake and pudding mixes. Beat in egg or egg substitute, then stir in coconut oil mixture. Mix in pecans and chocolate chips. Spoon into a 13 x 9-inch pan and bake for 25 to 30 minutes. Cool completely. In a medium bowl beat the sweetened condensed milk with the Kahlua until well blended. In a large bowl beat the softened cream cheese until smooth. Beat in the condensed milk mixture and mix until well blended. Fold in coconut. Pour over the cake layer and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

Cut off tough ends of asparagus. Slice into 2-inch lengths. Toss asparagus with extra virgin olive oil and grated garlic clove and salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Roast at 375 degrees F for about 10 minutes or until lightly browned and cooked through. Place asparagus onto plates and sprinkle with toasted almonds.

Combine all of the rice with 1 1/2 cups of milk. Mix well. Cook on medium heat for about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Mix in 2 eggs, 3/4 cup sugar, 2 tablespoons margarine, 2 tablespoons flour, and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. Stir well and continue to cook until thickened and bubbly. Remove from heat and pour into a 2-quart baking dish. Top with chopped pecans or walnuts. Let stand for at least 15 minutes before serving.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl and mix thoroughly. Use as usual on poultry.

Preheat grill. Season pork tenderloin with salt and pepper. Drizzle with butter. Grill pork for 10 to 12 minutes or until done. Remove from grill. Allow pork to rest for 5 minutes. To prepare sauce, in a large saucepan over medium heat, saute the onions in the butter until tender. Add the cranberries and wine. Cook until berries pop. Add honey. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low and cook 10 to 12 minutes or until slightly thickened. Stir in rosemary. Serve pork over mashed potatoes with sauce. Sprinkle with chopped fresh rosemary if desired.

In a 2-quart microwave-safe casserole, combine rice, water and 2 tbs vegetables. Microwave uncovered on high for 6-10 minutes. Stir in remaining vegetables. Stir in butter. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Microwave for 8-10 minutes or until heated through.

In a large bowl toss greens with apple slices and pecan halves. Whisk together blue cheese, dijon mustard, maple syrup, apple cider vinegar and olive oil in another bowl until blended well. Toss greens with blue cheese dressing. Garnish with dried cherries and pecan halves if desired. Serve.

Cut a square of cheesecloth and place it in a small bowl. Crush herbs into a paste. Add the butter and knead until the paste is smooth. Stir in the lemon juice and zest. Season with salt. Store in the refrigerator for up to two weeks.

Boil water for pasta according to directions. Drain pasta and set aside. In a saucepan melt butter and stir in flour and cook for 1 minute stirring constantly. Add milk and cream to saucepan and cook over medium heat stirring constantly for 2-3 minutes until slightly thickened. Add cheeses and stir until melted and combined with sauce. Stir in pasta and salt and pepper to taste and serve.

Place potatoes and carrots in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer and cook for 10 to 12 minutes or until tender. Drain. Add to a crockpot with beef stew meat and sauce. Cover and cook for 6 to 8 hours or until meat is tender and vegetables are cooked through. Serve with an assortment of breads. Makes 8 servings.

Mix goat cheese and spaghetti sauce together. Place chicken in a ziploc bag and coat with goat cheese mixture. Add the garlic powder and pepper to the mixture. Place in a gallon size ziploc bag and marinate for 20 minutes. Place on a baking sheet and bake at 400f for 20 minutes. While the chicken is cooking place a saucer in the microwave and cook for 30 seconds. Then mix the sauce with the mozzarella and spread on each roll. Then add a slice of goat cheese to each roll. Serve with the chicken.

In a skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add celery and cook for 2 minutes longer until celery is tender. Add green onion and cook for another minute. Add beans, tuna, olives, tomatoes and parsleyseason with salt and pepper to taste. Cook for about 15 minutes or until the tomatoes soften. Remove from the heat and add salad dressing. Mix well. Serve the salad over lettuce or greens with a hardboiled egg garnish if desired.

Brown turkey in a large skillet until no longer pink. Drain and discard fat. Stir in barley, tomato paste and broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered for about 15 minutes or until barley is tender and liquid has thickened slightly. Add remaining ingredients and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes or until barley is tender. Serve over cooked rice or egg noodles or alone. Makes 4 servings.

To prepare hummus: Drain the chickpeas. Place them into a food processor with garlic, oil, lemon juice, turmeric, chili powder, cilantro, paprika and salt. Puree until smooth. Taste for seasoning. Transfer the hummus to a serving dish. Serve with pita bread.

Preheat oven to 400. Rub seasoning onto both sides of the chicken and bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and brush with olive oil, balsamic vinegar and garlic. Return to oven and bake another 5 minutes. Allow to rest for 5 minutes before serving. This can be made in advance and reheated to serve.

Take your watermelon and cut off both ends. Then use a small saw or knife to cut the flesh of the watermelon into chunks. Add chunks to a blender or food processor. Add lemon juice and sugar and blend together until smooth. Pour mixture into glasses. Garnish with lemon slices.

Prepare a jelly roll pan by coating with cooking spray. Prepare crisp rice cereal mix by mixing all ingredients together. Set aside. Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Dip chicken in butter. Dip into crisp rice cereal mix. Place chicken on prepared jelly roll pan. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes.

In a large skillet over medium heat, heat oil. Saute the onions and green bell peppers. Add the tortillas to the skillet. Beat the eggs, then add to the skillet. Stir until the eggs are cooked. Remove the mixture from the pan. Cover with a sheet of foil. Place the pan in a cold oven. Bake for 15 minutes. Remove the foil. Top the mixture with the remaining ingredients and bake until cheese melts.

Grease and flour a 9 x 5″ loaf pan and preheat the oven to 375F. Cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy and add the egg one at a time, beating well after each addition. In another bowl combine the dry ingredients and fold into the creamed mixture. Spoon into the prepared pan and bake for about 1 hour until golden and set. Let cool before cutting and serving.

Brown turkey in a large skillet over medium heat until cooked through. Drain fat from skillet. Add tater tots to skillet and cook for a few minutes. Add mushroom soup mixture to skillet and bring to a boil. Add green beans to soup mixture and cook for 4 to 5 minutes. Stir in cheese until it is melted. Serve over tots. Makes 6 servings.

Cook beef as directed on package. Meanwhile, combine barbecue sauce, teriyaki sauce, chipotle chiles in adobo, saltstir well. Brush both sides of each roll with mayonnaise. Top with beef. Spread barbecue sauce mixture over each sandwich.

Cream butter and sugar in large bowl until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time. Beat until light and fluffy. Add almond extract. Beat in flour and soda. Add almonds. Stir in enough water to make dough hold together. Divide in half. Shape each half into a ball. Flatten into a disk. Dip disk into egg whites. Roll in sugar. Place cookies on greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 for 12-15 minutes. Cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut bread into 1-inch thick slices. Place bread into 11 by 7-inch baking dish. Combine tomatoes with green onion. Season with salt and pepper. Spoon tomato mixture over bread. Top with mozzarella cheese. In a medium bowl, beat eggs and milk with butter. Pour egg mixture over bread. Bake until center is set, about 30 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before cutting into bars.

Cook rice pilaf mix according to package directions. Drain. Meanwhile, in large skillet, saute artichokes in olive oil until golden brown. Drain. Add artichokes to rice pilaf with tomatoes, bell peppers, parsley, capers and lemon rind. Stir together. Season with sugar, lemon juice, salt and pepper. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving.
Mix all spices and salt into a small bowl.
Dissolve sugar in wateradd pecans. Boil 5 minutesadd egg white. Boil 1 minutedrain. Dip pecans in sugar mixturecool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Crush pineapple with juice from 1/2 a cup. Stir in orange juice and orange zest. Fill a small bowl with cold water. Heat a small nonstick skillet over medium heat. Stir in sugar until dissolved. Add pineapple mixture and bring to a boil. Stir in gelatin. Remove from heat and add to cold water bath. Let sit until mixture thickens and becomes opaque. Meanwhile, beat together eggs and vanilla. Beat in 1/2 cup of the pineapple mixture. Fold in the remaining pineapple mixture and neufchatel cheese. Pour into the prepared pie shell and bake for 15 minutes. Serve chilled.

In a small bowl, mix together cream cheese with imitation crabmeat. Season with pepper & garlic powder. Place a small amount of the mixture in the center of each wonton wrapper. Moisten edges with water. Fold in half to make triangles. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Place wontons in the pan. Fry on both sides for 3-4 minutes. Serve with sweet & sour sauce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease and line the sides and bottom of an 8 inch springform pan or a 9 inch square pan with butter or spray with cooking spray. In a small bowl mix together graham cracker crumbs and butter and spread into prepared pan. Place in freezer until firm but not set. Meanwhile in a large bowl beat together the cream cheese and splenda granular until well blended. Add in the sour cream and beat until well blended. Add in the lime juice and beat until well blended. Add in the eggs one at a time beating until well blended after each addition. Add in the cream cheese mixture and beat until well blended and creamy. Pour mixture into pan and bake for 45 minutes or until center is just set but jiggle a little to the side and it moves around. Remove from oven and let cool completely before removing sides of pan and refrigerate for several hours or over night. Serve cold with your favorite fruit topping and whipped cream if desired. Recipe submitted by: Shirley J., Fay

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease an 8×8 inch baking dish with 1 tablespoon butterset aside. In a large pot over medium-high heat, bring 6 cups of water to boil. Cook wild rice according to package directions, until tender but not mushydrain. Place wild rice in large bowl and cover with cold waterlet sit for 10 minutes. Drain wild ricediscard water from rice. Place wild rice in prepared baking dish. In medium bowl, whisk together eggs, cream, salt and cayenne pepperpour over rice in baking dish. Stir in corn kernelscover with foil and bake in preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes or until set. Remove from ovensprinkle with remaining 2 tablespoons butterserve warm.

Preheat the oven to 450 degrees f. Heat the olive oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and the green bell peppers and sauté until the peppers are tender-crisp and golden brown about 15 minutes. Drain the oil from the pan and discard the garlic cloves and the sliced onion. Place the green bell peppers on a cutting board and slice into rings. Place the sliced rings on a foil-lined baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil and season with sea salt and black pepper. Bake for 25 minutes or until golden brown and crispy.

Cut cabbage and bell peppers into small pieces. In a large bowl or plastic container combine the oil, whole seeds of the spices and sugar. Add the vinegar and stir. Add the cabbage and bell peppers and toss to coat. Let sit in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours. Serve over a bed of lettuce. For a sweet touch, sprinkle with chopped walnuts. Add a dollop of mayonnaise if desired.
Mix all ingredients in a bowl until smooth. Toss with fruit.

Preheat oven to 350f. Place peaches and apple pie spice in the bottom of pie crusts. Sprinkle with cornstarch. In a small bowl combine brown sugar and cinnamon. Drizzle with melted butter. Top with pie crust. Bake for 50 to 60 minutes, until crust is golden brown. Let cool for 5 to 10 minutes. Serve warm.
Drain canned green chilies well. Crumble cooked chicken. Mix all ingredients well. Serve with tortilla chips.

Heat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a bowl, stir together spinach, ricotta cheese, parmesan cheese, cracked black pepper and garlic powder. Place 2 wonton wrappers on a lightly greased baking sheet and spoon in 1/3 cup of spinach mixture. Top with 1/3 cup of spinach mixturewrap in tortilla. Continue with remaining wonton wrappers and filling. Brush tortillas with cooking spray. Bake in the preheated oven for 12 minutes or until tortillas are golden brown.

Combine all the salmon fillet marinade ingredients. Mix thoroughly. Marinate salmon fillets for at least 30 minutes. After marinating place salmon fillets on preheated grill for 5 minutes on each side. Serve with french dressing.

Preheat the oven to 350 f. Slice the potatoes into 1/4 inch thick slices. Place the potato slices in a glass baking dish. Slice the red onion and place in a glass baking dish. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Place the chicken on a glass baking dish. Season with salt and pepper. Slice the tomato and place on a glass baking dish. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Drizzle the lemon juice and lemon zest over all. Add the garlic cloves and olives. Place the baking dishes on a baking sheet and place in the oven. Bake the chicken for 15 minutes. Bake the potatoes for 15 minutes. Bake the onions and tomatoes for 20 minutes. Remove the baking dishes from the oven and set aside. Slice the chicken and place on a plate. Drain the onions and tomatoes. Slice the potatoes. Place a potato slice on each plate. Add

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Slice bacon into thin slices. Place bacon slices on a foil lined cookie sheet. Place in oven until crisp. Dice bacon into small pieces. Remove bacon from oven. In a large skillet melt butter. Add chopped onions. Saute onions over medium heat until translucent. Add chopped garlic cloves. Cook until garlic is fragrant. Add black beans. Season with cumin, salt & pepper. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir until black beans are heated through. Remove from heat. To serve, place black beans on a tortilla. Top black beans with sour cream. Add diced bacon. Add hot sauce. Serve immediately.

Cook ground beef and drain. Add salsa and simmer. Stir in beans. Spoon meat mixture into 2 (9-inch) pie pans. Add 1/2 cup water. Top with prepared polenta. Cut polenta into squares. Sprinkle cheese over polenta. Bake at degrees for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Peel the potatoes and boil in salted water until tender. Drain and cool slightly. Purée the potatoes in a food processor or blender. Add the soft goat cheese, butter and half-and-half to the puréed potatoes. Stir in the basil. Season with salt and pepper. Heat the mixture in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat until warm. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add steaks and cook until desired doneness. Slice steaks into 1/2 inch slices. Heat remaining oil in skillet over medium heat. Add oysters to hot oil. Cook 5 minutes. Drain oysters. Combine oysters with steak slices. Sprinkle with teriyaki. Serve on toast or buns.

Combine the brown sugar and maple syrup. Heat over medium heat until sugar dissolves. Add butter. Stir in half-and-half. Bring to a boil. Add vanilla extract. Remove from heat and let cool. Crumble in walnuts. Serve over ice cream.

Combine lemonade concentrate and honey in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Remove from heat and stir in poppy seeds. Allow to cool. In a large bowl, toss together fruit. Add dressing and toss to coat. Serve immediately. Cover and refrigerate leftovers.

Preheat oven to 180 c. Sift together flour, cocoa, brown sugar and bicarbonate of soda into a bowl. Using an electric mixer or wooden spoon, beat butter, brown sugar and eggs until light and fluffy. Add milk and mix in. Fold in chocolate chips. Pour mixture on to a floured board and roll out to about 1/2 cm thickness. Using cookie cutters of desired shapes (round or square), cut out cookies and place on baking trays lined with baking paper. Bake for 10-15 minutes or until lightly browned on the edges. Remove from oven when cool enough to handle, then transfer cookies to wire racks to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Peel potatoes and cut into fries about 3/4 inch thick and 2 1/2 to 3 inches long. Dip fries in oil then sprinkle cajun seasoning and salt and pepper on both sides of fries and lay on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake 10 to 15 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through. Enjoy!

Clean artichokes by removing the stem and trimming off the sharp edges of the leaves with a knife. Cut the leaves lengthwise in half and remove the choke. Brush with extra virgin olive oil, salt and pepper. Place on a pre-heated grill and cook for 2 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Set aside and let cool. Pre-heat a pan on medium heat and add the oil. Add the garlic and cook until golden brown. Add the artichokes, thyme and cook for another 2 minutes. Set aside and let cool. In a shallow dish place the parmesan and season with salt and pepper. Place a piece of artichoke in the center of each breast and sprinkle with the cheese mixture. Place in a pre-heated pan and cook for 5-7 minutes or until the cheese melts and the meat is cooked through and no longer pink inside.

Clean asparagus by removing tough ends with knife or fingers. Remove woody ends from mushroomsdiscard ends. Chop mushrooms finely or slice into 1/2-inch-thick slices. Set aside. In small bowl, whisk together lemon juice and reduced-fat italian salad dressingset aside. In 10-inch skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add asparaguscook 4 minutes or until crisp-tender. Add mushroomscook 1 minute or until heated through. Transfer asparagus mixture to serving dishtoss with dressing mixture and almonds.

Preheat the oven to 180C. Butter a large baking sheet. In a bowl combine the rolled oats with the pecans and walnuts. In a medium saucepan over medium heat combine the honey, cinnamon and 1/2 cup of water. Bring the mixture to a boil. Immediately remove from the heat and pour the hot honey mixture over the rolled oats and nuts. Add the dried cranberries and raisins and toss well. Spread the mixture onto the prepared baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes. Remove the mixture from the oven and stir. Return the mixture to the oven and bake for another 15 minutes until golden brown. Pour the granola onto a wire rack and allow it to cool completely. Store in an airtight container.

Boil lemons in water for 1 minute. Remove from water and cool in ice bath for 15 minutes. Peel lemons and cut into wedges. Add edamame and cajun seasonings to the boiling water and cook for 3 to 4 minutes until edamame are tender. Drain and rinse under cold water. Toss with cayenne and lemon wedges and serve immediately.

Dice onions and cook in a little butter. Add braunschweiger and cook till browned. Add worcestershire sauce and cook till blended. Add cream cheese and cook till blended. Add onions and stir till blended. Stir in chopped parsley and chives. Serve with crackers.

Heat a 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Coat pan with cooking spray. Add fish filletscook 4 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Remove fish from pankeep warm. Reduce heat to medium. Add mushrooms and 1 cup broth to pancook 4 minutes or until liquid is almost evaporated and mushrooms are tender. Add mustard and remaining 1/4 cup broth to mushrooms in pancook 4 minutes. Remove pan from heat. Place 1/3 cup broth in a small bowladd flourstirring constantly, cook over medium-high heat 1 minute or until mixture forms a thick paste. Gradually whisk mixture into mushroom mixture. Stir in whipping cream. Bring to a boil over medium-high heatcook 2 minutes or until thickened. Return fish to pantoss gently to coat. Cover and keep warm. Garnish each serving with parsley sprigs and lemon wedges.

Cream together the butter and sugar. Stir in the barbecue sauce until combined. Combine the eggs with the flour. Add to the sugar mixture. Stir in the spices and baking soda. Add the flour mixture to sugar mixture. Mix together. Place by spoonfuls on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 400 degrees for 10-12 minutes. Makes about 3 dozen cookies.

Melt the cheeses in separate sauce pans. Add the almond extract and nutmeg in each cheese pan. Make sure not too hot or they will burn. In a separate sauce pan combine cornstarch with water and stir until the cornstarch is dissolved. Then add in the champagne. Stir until the cornstarch is dissolved and the mixture is smooth. Pour the champagne mixture into one cheese pan first. Then add the brie cheese into the pan, stirring until blended. Pour the other cheese into the pan and stir until blended. Then stir in the apples. Serve with slices of french bread or breadsticks as dippers. Enjoy!

Place a medium non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add the olive oil and heat until it begins to shimmer. Add the tuna to the pan and saut until it is golden brown. Remove the tuna from the pan using a slotted spoon and set aside. Add the cannellini beans to the pan and continue to saut until they become warm. Add the pecorino cheese to the pan and saut until it is melted and golden brown. Add the eggs to the pan and scramble until it is set but still soft. Season the eggs with the oregano, black pepper, salt and add the tuna to the eggs. Remove from heat and transfer the egg mixture to a 9x13 glass baking dish or any baking pan you prefer. Add the baby spinach leaves to the bottom of the pan. Place the frittata into a 350 degree oven for 15 minutes. Let sit for 5 minutes then cut into small squares and serve warm.

Preheat grill to medium high heat. Wash and dry eggplant and place on grill skin side down. Cook for about 10 minutes or until skins are charred, then turn over and cook for another 10 minutes or until soft. While eggplant is cooking, slice bread in half lengthwise. Spread both sides of bread with olive oil. Cut tomatoes in half lengthwise, remove seeds and place on grill skin side down over heat until skins are slightly blistered. Remove from heat and set aside. Finely chop tomatoes. Sprinkle eggplants with salt and pepper and set aside. In bowl mix together mozzarella and chopped tomatoes. Once eggplant has cooled slice in half lengthwise. Slice each half into thirds lengthwise. Place sandwich bread on work surface with cut side down. Place each slice of bread on the work surface with the cut side facing up. Spread each slice with tomato mixture. Place 1 slice of eggplant on each sandwich. Garnish with a few basil leaves and a sprinkling of coarse sea salt. Serve immediately.

Prepare and bake a shortbread crust according to package directions. Cool completely. Meanwhile, in a large mixing bowl, beat the cream cheese until smooth. Gradually beat in the sugar until well blended. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating just until blended after each addition. Stir in the frozen orange juice concentrate. Pour half of the filling into the crust and smooth. Top with mandarin orange halves in juice. Refrigerate for several hours or overnight. Garnish with additional mandarin oranges. Serve with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream.

Cut carrots into bite-sized pieces. Peel and core pears. Peel pineapples. Slice pears into bite-sized pieces. Combine carrots, pears, pineapple, and liquid pectin in large saucepan. Add lemon juice and spices. Cook over medium heat until the fruit is soft and the mixture begins to bubble. Stir constantly. Add sugar and continue to cook until the mixture begins to thicken and comes to full rolling boil. Remove from the heat. Skim off any foam that may form. Add vanilla and pour into hot sterilized jars. Process in water bath for 10 minutes. Store in cool dark place for up to 12 months.

In a large skillet brown ground chicken with garlic and onions over medium-high heat. Drain chicken well and set aside. Add tomato sauce, salsa, chili powder, cayenne pepper, salt and pepper to skillet and bring to boil. Stir in beans. Pour over tortillas and top with grated cheese. Cover and bake at 350° for 30 minutes or till hot through. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Melt butter in a saucepanadd sugar and stir to mix. Add eggs and stir to combine. Add the dry ingredients and stir. Pour into a greased 9x13 baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool. Spoon a little jam in the center of each slice. Roll up the slice and place in a greased 8x8 baking dish. Dot the top with butter and bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from the oven and serve. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Brush the potatoes with the extra virgin olive oil and season generously with sea salt and ground black pepper. Place the potatoes on a large baking sheet and roast for 50 to 60 minutes or until tender when pierced with a fork. Remove from the oven and add the garlic cloves and the fresh rosemary to the potatoes and toss to coat with the oil and herbs. Return to the oven for 10 to 15 more minutes or until the potatoes are golden brown and crisp. Serve warm.

Cut the brussels sprouts in quarters and set aside. In a small bowl mix together the sriracha sauce and honey. Drizzle the sauce over the brussel sprouts and toss to coat. Add olive oil and toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Roast the sprouts in the oven for 10 minutes at 450F. Toss the sprouts with the lime juice and serve.

Preheat the oven to 180c/gas mark 4. In a large bowl, beat together the eggs, sugar and kirsch until well blended. Stir in the anise seed and salt and then add the flour until it forms a soft dough. Turn the dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth. Roll out the dough until it is approximately 3mm thick (this is easier to do if you use a pasta machine). Cut out rounds using a biscuit cutter and place on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake in the oven for about 8 minutes until the biscuits are lightly golden. Cool the biscuits on the tray for about 10 minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely. Makes about 30 biscuits.
Add sugar to a saucepan and fill with water. Bring to a boil and boil for 2 minutes. Add cream of tartar and salt. Continue to boil for another minute or two. Cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line 2 standard 9 inch round cake pans with waxed paper. In a medium bowl beat together bananas and oil until creamy. In a large bowl beat together the flour, sugar, baking soda and salt until well blended. Gradually add the banana mixture to the flour mixture and stir until well blended. Fold in the eggs and chocolate chips. Pour batter evenly between the two cake pans. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in pans on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Remove from pans and cool completely on rack. Frost with Creamy Chocolate Icing.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Heat a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add oil and onion soup mix. Cook for 3 minutes or until onion is tender. Add beef to the pan. Cook 20 minutes or until done (140 degrees F for medium). Pour in cream of mushroom soup. Stir in water. Simmer for 10 minutes. Spoon beef mixture into a greased 1 1/2 quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with the bread crumbs. Bake for 30 minutes or until heated through. Makes 6 servings.

Heat 2 tbs olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add veal scallopini in batches and saute for about 6 minutes on each side. Remove from pan to a plate. Add remaining olive oil to skilletheat over medium heat. Add butter to melt completelyadd garlic to skillet and saute for 1 minute. Add tomatoesseason with oregano, salt & pepper. Cook until tomatoes just begin to break down. Add white wine to tomato mixture. Stir in veal scallopini and parsley. Continue to saute over low heat for about 5 minutes.

Heat margarine in saucepan. Cook mushrooms and onions in it until tender. Add flour and cook for 30 seconds stirring constantly. Gradually add soymilk stirring constantly until thickened and bubbly. Add garlic powder and salt and pepper to taste and cook for 2 minutes more stirring constantly. Add green beans and french-fried onions and toss together. Cook over medium heat for 4 minutes. Transfer to serving dish.

Clean broccoli and place on a cookie sheet. Slice the garlic cloves and place them next to the broccoli on the cookie sheet. Drizzle the oil flavored cooking spray on the broccoli and garlic and coat the broccoli and garlic with the spray. Cover the broccoli with the teriyaki sauce and then sprinkle with the fresh ground black pepper. Place the broccoli and garlic into the preheated oven and bake for 30 minutes or until the broccoli is soft and tender and the garlic is golden brown in color.

In a large saucepan, combine rice and water. Cook over medium heat until all the water is absorbed and the rice is tender. Stir in the pineapple, marshmallows and almonds. Cover and cook for 5 minutes. In a medium bowl, whisk together the heavy cream and sugar. Add the vanilla and beat well. Fold into the rice mixture. Spoon into serving bowls and serve. Makes 16 servings.

Saute yellow bell peppers, orange bell peppers, mushrooms, onions and garlic. In a large skillet brown chicken with 1/4 cup of olive oil. Stir in diced tomatoes, seasonings and water. Cook until sauce thickens and reduce heat to low. Saute spinach for 30 seconds to 1 minute. Stir spinach into sauce. Cook until spinach is wilted, then add 1/2 cup of shredded cheddar cheese. Remove from heat and stir in cooked pasta until well mixed. Pour into a lightly greased 9 x 13 baking pan. Sprinkle remaining cheddar cheese over top. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-30 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Bring chicken stock to a boil in a large saucepan over high heat. Add the onion and cook 2 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the potatoes and the brussels sprouts and cook 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the red pepper and cook 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the bay leaf and cook 3 minutes more, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and keep warm. Roughly chop the parsley and add to the vegetables. Season to taste with salt and pepper and serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Peel and cube beets and parsnips. Toss vegetables with olive oil and sprinkle with brown sugar. Place in a baking dish and roast until tender. While vegetables are roasting, prepare mushrooms. Place shiitake mushrooms in a saute pan with 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Saute for about 2 minutes. Remove mushrooms from pan and place on baking dish with the roasted vegetables. Stir apple cider vinegar into pan juices and cook for about 1-2 minutes. Pour over vegetables and mushrooms and place in oven. Roast for an additional 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Remove the giblets from the cavity of the chicken. In a bowl whisk together the soy sauce, honey, sesame oil, ginger, garlic and black pepper. Place the chicken thighs in the bowl. Toss to coat. Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. Place the chicken skin side down on the grill. Cook for 5 minutes. Turn the chicken over. Baste the chicken with the marinade. Cook for 10 minutes. Turn the chicken over. Baste the chicken with the marinade. Cook for 10 minutes. Remove the chicken from the grill. Serve with the green onions.
Cook sausage and egg as directed on package for sausage patties and english muffins. Spread margarine on english muffins and place sausage patty on top. Top with cheese and fried egg and serve.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Coat steak with cooking spray in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Arrange mushrooms around steak in dish. In a small bowl, combine onion, soup and waterpour over mushrooms. Sprinkle steak with mustardtop with rice and parsley. Bake in preheated oven for 45 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 150 degrees F (65 degrees C). Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

In a large pot over medium heat, saute the onions in olive oil for 3 minutes or until tender. Add the radishes and cucumber, and cook for 3 minutes or until tender. Stir in the flour until it is completely absorbed. Add the vinegar and water to the potato mixture in the pot and bring to boiling over medium heat. Cook for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally with a wooden spoon, until potatoes are tender. Drain in a colander set over a bowl to catch the liquid from the potatoes. Stir in the potatoes, salt and pepper, and toss to coat. Let cool for 10 minutes, and then serve.

In a large zip-top plastic bag, combine garlic powder, dried basil, salt, pepper, instant minced onion and garlic clovesseal bag. Add balsamic vinegar and oil. Place bagged chicken in a large crock potpour marinade over top of chickenseal crock potcook on low setting for 6 hours or on high setting for 4 hours. Remove chicken from marinadeplace on serving platter and sprinkle with parsley. Serve with cooked rice, if desired. Makes approximately 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. In large bowl, combine dates, walnut pieces, cherry candies and flour. Stir in remaining dry ingredients. In separate bowl, beat together eggs, sugar and vanilla extract until frothy. Stir into date mixture until combined. Pour into greased 10-inch tube pan. Bake 1 hour 15 minutes. Remove from pan immediately. Let stand 20 minutes before slicing.

Put bread slices in buttered pan in a preheated 375 degree F. Oven for 10 minutes. Sprinkle each side of bread lightly with shredded cheese. Add bacon pieces. Layer tomato slices. Top each side of sandwich with another bread slice. Grill sandwiches in a preheated 450 degree F. Grill until golden brown. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Mix rhubarb, 3/4 cup sugar, flour, salt and nutmeg. Pour into 9-inch pie shell. Whisk eggs. Mix in the remaining 1/4 cup sugar. Pour over rhubarb. Bake 30 to 40 minutes until filling is set. Cool. Serve warm. (If using frozen rhubarb, thaw before using.)
Combine soups and corn in a large bowl. Add remaining ingredientsmix well. Spoon into a greased 9x5x3 inch loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 to 40 minutes.

In a pan over medium heat combine garlic cloves and olive oil. Add broccoli florets and cook about 5 minutes until broccoli begins to brown slightly. Add chicken and cook 3 minutes or until chicken is warmed through. Add tomatoes and parmesan cheese and cook 2 minutes. Add spaghetti and cook according to package directions. Sprinkle with basil and black pepper. Serve and enjoy!

Pound the lemongrass stalk with the bottom of a heavy pan until it is about as thick as a pencil. Peel off the outer layers and use the knife to cut the lemongrass into 6-inch-long pieces. Cut off the tougher root end and set aside. Put the lemongrass pieces on the bottom of a large roasting pan and add enough chicken broth to cover them. Cover the pan and bring the liquid to a simmer. Add the chicken breasts and poach them for 5 minutes. Remove the chicken from the broth and keep warm. Drain the broth. Remove the lemongrass pieces from the pan and reserve the broth. Return the pan to the stove and bring it to a simmer. Add the macadamia nut oil and the lime rind. Bring the liquid back to a simmer. Add the birds eye chiles and the garlic clove and simmer until the garlic is tender. Add the lemongrass pieces and the chicken broth and bring the liquid back to a simmer. Add the chicken and simmer until it is tender and the lemongrass is tender.

Prepare pasta according to package directions. Drain. Meanwhile, heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add sausage and cook until browned. Add tomatoes and simmer for about 20 minutes. Pour sausage and tomatoes into 13x9 baking dish. Increase heat to high. Add pasta to skillet and cook until tender. Drain and add to baking dish. Stir together breadcrumbs and cheese. Sprinkle over pasta mixture and bake at 350e for about 20 minutes.

Combine tea bags with watersteep for a few minutes. Serve over ice with oranges (sliced) and lemons (squeezed) in a large pitcher with orange juice and lemon juice added to taste. Stir honey into glasses before serving with club soda or tonic water. Garnish with a slice of orange or a wedge of lime if desired.

Put all ingredients into the bread maker in the order recommended by the manufacturer. Select the bread type you want (dough or bake). Select the crust setting if desired. Select the timer. When finished baking, remove the bread from the bread maker. Remove the bread from the bread pan. Serve warm.

Season pork butt liberally with kosher salt and black pepper and rub with the ginger ale and barbecue sauce. Cover and refrigerate overnight. The next day, preheat oven to 275 degrees. Remove the pork butt from the refrigerator and let it come to room temperature. Place pork butt in roasting pan and cover with lid. Roast until the internal temperature is reached (160 degrees). Once the pork butt reaches the desired internal temperature, remove from the oven and let it rest for at least an hour before slicing. Serve with the barbecue sauce.

Put butter, margarine, chocolate chips in a large mixing bowl. Beat with an electric mixer for 3 minutes at high speed until well mixed. Add egg and beat 2 minutes more until blended well. Fold in nuts and marshmallows. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper-lined baking sheets. Bake for 10-12 minutes until lightly browned.

In 3 1/2 - quart crock pot, combine onion, bouillon cubes and beef. Cover and cook on low 6 to 8 hours or on high 4 to 5 hours or until beef is tender. Add beef broth and winestir well. Increase heat to highbring to a boil. Reduce heat to lowsimmer 10 minutes or until gravy is thickened. Stir cornstarch mixture into gravy until smooth. Stir in cooked noodles. Cover and cook 5 minutes or until noodles are tender. Serve immediately. Makes 6 servings.

Place sugar in a large heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium heat, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon until the sugar is dissolved and the mixture begins to turn golden brown. Remove from heat and allow to cool for 5 minutes. Pour the sugar mixture onto a sheet of wax paper and spread it out to about 1/2 inch thick and 12 to 14 inches wide. Spread the cream cheese mixture evenly over the cooled sugar and allow the mixture to cool to room temperature (this should take about an hour). Once the cream cheese mixture is completely cooled, refrigerate until set for about 1 hour (about the time to bake the cookies). Remove the sheet of wax paper and the cream cheese mixture from the refrigerator and use a knife to cut the mixture into 1-inch pieces. Roll each piece of cream cheese into a ball and flatten to form a 1/2-inch-thick disk. Refrigerate until completely firm (about 1 hour). Use a candy thermometer to heat the sugar syrup and the cream to 235 degrees F (115

Slice the garlic cloves in half and rub the cut side of each clove over the bottom of a large shallow bowl. (The flavor of the garlic is absorbed by the bowl.) Sprinkle the salt over the garlic and stir to coat the garlic with the salt. Add the garlic to the bowl with the Parmesan cheese, red wine vinegar, olive oil, Worcestershire sauce, black pepper, and 1/4 tsp. freshly ground black pepper. Let sit at room temperature for 15 minutes. Stir well then add the bacon bits. Add the romaine lettuce leaves to the bowl then toss with the dressing and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350°F. Season the chicken breast halves on both sides with salt and pepper. Place in an ungreased shallow roasting pan and roast for about 20 minutes or until the juices run clear when the thickest part of the meat is pierced with a fork. In a small bowl, combine the green onions and jalapenosset aside. In a small saucepan over low heat, combine the lemon juice and honeybring to a boil and boil for 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and cool slightlypour into a large bowl and stir in the thyme and reserved onion mixture. Brush the chicken breast halves on both sides with the honey mixture and place in the hot roasting pan in a single layer. Cover the pan and roast for about 15 minutes or until the juices run clear when the thickest part of the meat is pierced with a fork. Serve warm or cold. Makes 2 servings.
Mix dry ingredients together in bowl. Add butter, sugar and eggs in separate bowl. Combine with dry mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until muffin tops are light brown.

In a crock pot, combine beef with tomato paste, 1 cup of the wine mixture, 1 cup of the water mixture. Add remaining wine mixture, water mixture, sugar, garlic cloves, salt and pepper. Cover crock pot. Cook on low for 5 hours. Add onion soup mix. Cook an additional 1 hour. Transfer beef to serving platter. Pour sauce from crock pot over top of roast. Serve with rice or potatoes.

Cream together the butter, sugars and vanilla. Beat eggs into the creamed mixture and combine with flour, baking soda and salt. Fold chocolate chips and nuts into the batter.
