Add some berries and top it off with the marshmallow syrup. Makes about one cup of syrup.

Combine all ingredients, except olives, in food processor until smooth. With processor running, gradually blend in olives until smooth. Transfer to serving dish, sprinkle with paprika. Serve with crackers.

Cut marmalade into small pieces. In a bowl combine bisquick baking mix and cold water. Mix well and form into balls. Roll in orange marmalade. Place on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 425 degrees for 12 minutes. Serve with butter.

Cream together butter and sugar. Add the flour and baking soda to the butter mixture and beat until blended. Stir in oatmeal. Fill paper-lined muffin cups two-thirds full. Bake 18 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 5 minutes and remove from cups. Top each muffin with a dollop of frosting. (Recipe yields 12 muffins)
Place chicken breasts in a 4 or 5 quart slow cooker. Top with marmalade and juice. Add remaining ingredients. Cover and cook on low for 4 hours. Serve over rice.

Melt the butter in a pan and sauté the apples until they are soft. Set aside to cool. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees f. Combine all the breadcrumbs with the apple mixture. Grease a 10-inch casserole dish and place the apple mixture into it. In a bowl mix together the egg and the cream. Pour this mixture over the apple mixture and add the orange zest. Bake for 35 minutes. Allow the pudding to cool for 15 minutes before serving.

Make gravy mix according to package directions. Mix beef with worcestershire sauce. Drain fat from the gravy. Mix with the beef mixture. Stir in the gravy mixture. In a large bowl, combine the biscuit mix, milk and gravy. Mix well. Pour beef mixture into a greased 3-quart baking dish. Spoon the biscuit mixture over the beef. Pour the hot water over the biscuit mixture. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes. Let stand 15 minutes before serving. Serve with mashed potatoes.

Combine all the ingredients except the water in a saucepan. Bring to boil stirring constantly. Cook for 1 minute. Gradually whisk in the water while stirring constantly. Boil for another minute. Pour the mixture into small heatproof containers and cool completely before using.

Sift together the flour and cornmeal. Cut in the shortening until the mixture is crumbly. Stir in the baking powder and soda. Add sugar and mix thoroughly. In another bowl beat eggs. Stir the egg mixture into the dry mixture. Stir in water and oil. Turn out on floured board and knead until smooth. Place in greased bread pan. Bake at 425 degrees for 35-40 minutes. Remove from oven and turn out onto a wire rack. Let cool. Store in tin.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Arrange blueberries in bottom of pie shell. Place pie shell into the oven. Cook for about 5 minutes or until crust is brown. Meanwhile, make topping. In a bowl, combine flour, cinnamon and orange juice. Gradually add brown sugar until all the flour is moistened. Add the melted butter. Mix well. Pour the mixture over the pie shell. Bake for about 5 minutes or until the topping begins to brown. Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees. Bake for about an hour or until the filling is bubbly. Allow pie to cool for about 5 minutes before serving. Serve with a dollop of whipped cream if desired.

Beat eggs in a mixing bowl. Beat in ricotta cheese. Add cream, sugar substitute and spices. Stir until well blended. Pour into a greased muffin pan. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes at 350 degrees. Cool before removing from pan.

Cream sugar and cocoa powder together. Add the egg whites and corn syrup and beat until well combined. Stir in the baking powder and salt and then add the oats and the flour. Stir until just combined. Pour the mixture onto waxed paper and with the palms of your hands, roll the dough into walnut-sized balls. Place the balls of dough onto the bottom of the waxed paper and roll the dough balls with the palms of your hands into walnut-sized balls again. Then roll the balls in the cereal. Place the balls on ungreased baking sheets and bake for about 12 minutes. Let them cool for about 10 minutes and then transfer the cookies to cooling racks. These cookies will be crunchy if stored at room temperature or soft and chewy if stored in the refrigerator. Either way, they will taste yummy!

In a large saucepan over medium heat, heat 2 teaspoons of the oil. Add the onions, bell peppers, garlic, cumin, oregano, hot chili peppers, and a generous pinch of salt. Cook until the onions are translucent, about 5 minutes. Stir in the remaining oil. Add the chicken and cook until golden brown on both sides. Pour the lemon juice over the chicken. Stir. Cover with a lid and cook until the chicken is cooked through. Transfer the chicken to a cutting board. Strain the excess liquid from the pan. Add the juices from the pan to the chicken. Sprinkle the chicken with lemon juice. Cut the chicken into serving pieces. Serve over rice or couscous.

Wash rice and lentils several times with water until the water is clear of any dirt. Place lentils and rice in a large pot with enough water to cover. Bring to a boil over medium heat then reduce heat to low and simmer for 45 minutes or until rice is cooked through. Drain excess water from rice/lentils. Add oil to a large skillet over medium heat. Add onions and saute until onions are translucent, 5 to 7 minutes. Add rice/lentils to the skillet with the onions. Stir to combine. Add cumin and stir to combine. Cook for 5 minutes or until the rice/lentils are heated through. Serve immediately with lemon wedges or pita bread.

Cook the chopped onions in 1/3 cup of oil over moderate heat until tender. Add 4 cups of the tomatoes with juice and bring to boiling. Reduce heatcook uncovered, stirring occasionally for 25 to 30 minutes or until thickened. Blend 1/3 cup of the tomatoes with the chopped green chilies and 3 cups of the spinach. Add to the cooked tomatoes with the vinegar. Cook for about 10 minutes. Drain and transfer to a blender with the cream cheese and 3/4 cup of the half-and-half. Add 1/2 cup of the remaining half-and-half, the remaining cream and the cheese mixture. Process until smooth. Transfer to a bowlstir in the remaining 1/2 cup of half-and-half. Season with the salt and pepper. Transfer to a large serving bowl. Top with the remaining 1 cup of chopped spinach. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cook sausage until brown and drain well on paper towels. Layer crescent rolls and sausage pieces into pie plate and top with egg mixture and cheese. Bake for about 45 minutes or until done and golden brown.

Place rice in saucepan and cover with milk. Bring to boil over high heat and then reduce to low. Cover and let simmer 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in coconut extract. Sprinkle with coconut flakes.

Prepare crust: In a food processor or blender, mix together graham cracker crumbs, margarine, soy cream cheese and 1/2 cup brown sugar. Mix well. Press firmly onto the bottom and sides of a 9-inch springform pan. Prepare filling: In a food processor or blender, mix together 1 cup brown sugar and 1 cup nonfat soy milk. Add the pumpkin puree and cooking rum. Blend until smooth. Pour into the crust. Bake for 50 to 60 minutes or until set. Cool completely. Refrigerate 2 hours. Prepare topping: In a food processor or blender, mix together remaining brown sugar and 1 cup nonfat soy milk. Blend until smooth. Pour over top of cheesecake. Refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving. To serve, remove side of pan. Dust with cinnamon-nutmeg mixture. Garnish with pecans and cranberries.

In a small bowl, combine eggs, water, biscuit mix, onions, and cayenne pepper. Beat well with a fork. Pour into a greased 9 x 9 or 9 x 13 inch baking pan. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 375 degrees for 30 to 35 minutes. This is a great recipe to serve with a simple green salad. Enjoy!
Mix together all ingredients except pork chops and put into a baking dish. Put pork chops on top and bake at 300 degrees for 1 hour and 30 minutes to 1 hour and 45 minutes.

Peel potatoes and cut into large slices. Boil until tender then drain. Dip in beaten egg then roll in coconut and almonds. Lay in a lightly greased 13 x 9 x 2 inch pan and pour milk over them. Sprinkle with vanilla and powdered sugar. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and immediately sprinkle with grated dark chocolate. Serve warm.

Combine soup and milkblend with 1/2 cup of the cheese. Stir in the chicken. Fill crescent rolls with the cheese mixturefold in ends of dough to seal. Place sealed crescents on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 350f for 20 minutes or until golden brown.

Heat the butter in a pan until melted. Add the onion and saute until tender. Add courgettes and stir until cooked through. Cook the pasta until al dente then drain. Toss the cooked pasta with the butter/onion/courgettes mix along with the walnuts and parsley. Stir over a low heat until heated through then add the cream and parmesan cheese and stir until melted. Serve immediately accompanied by a salad of your choice.
Add strong coffee to a blender. Add brown sugar, vanilla bean seeds and blend. Add bananas, almonds, ice cubes. Blend until smooth.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Prepare baking sheet with non-stick baking spray. Mix ground turkey with soup and eggs. Add oats, garlic cloves and onion. Mix thoroughly. Shape mixture into 8 to 10 meatloaves. Place on baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes. Flip meatloaves over. Bake for an additional 20 minutes. Let sit for 10 minutes before serving. Serve with mashed potatoes.

Cook the rice according to the package directions. Add the beans to the rice for the last five minutes of cooking time. Add the mexicorn, ground turkey and seasonings to the rice. Cover the rice with cheese for the last five minutes of cooking time. Serve warm with tortilla chips.

Place meat in bottom of pressure cooker. Fill with water. Place vegetables on top of meat. Covercook on high pressure for 1 1/2 hours. Let the pressure out naturally. Remove meat. Remove vegetables. Serve over hot rice.

Boil the potatoes until tender, and cool. Grate the potatoes, and mix with egg yolks. Add flour until the gnocchi mixture is smooth. Dump the gnocchi mixture onto a lightly floured board. Flatten into 1/2 inch disks. Cook the gnocchi in boiling water until they rise to the top. Remove from water with a slotted spoon. Dump gnocchi into a large skillet. Add the boiling water, salt and 1 tbsp. Butter. Cook over medium heat until the gnocchi are softened. Drain well. Stir in the spinach. Transfer to serving bowls. Top with the remaining 1 tbsp. Butter.

Mix together sugar, peanuts and corn syrup. Put mixture into a mold that has a hollow center. Place the mold on a baking sheet. Set aside. In a small saucepan, heat the rice flour over medium heat. Stir constantly for about 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Let cool. When the peanut mixture is set, drizzle the rice flour mixture over the top. Let set for about one hour. Remove from mold. Enjoy!

Sift together the flours into a large mixing bowl. Add the butter and cut it into small pieces with your fingertips. Add the eggs, one at a time, whisking until incorporated. Add the milk while whisking. Beat until smooth. Whisk in salt. Pour mixture into the popover pan and bake for 15 to 20 minutes. Allow popovers to stand in pan for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool.

In large skillet cook ground beef and diced onions together with paprika. Drain. Add kidney beans and tomatoes. Simmer for 30 minutes. Stir in cooked rice and heat through. Mix in monterey jack and green bell peppers. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in butter and season with salt and pepper. Serve hot. Serves 4.

Brown ground turkey and onion in a large saucepan. Cook over medium-high heat until turkey is no longer pink and onions are tender. Drain and discard the fat from the pan. Stir in the beans, salsa and refried beans until combined. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 10 minutes or until beans are heated through and thickened slightly. Stir in the chili powder and cumin. Taste and add additional spices as needed to your liking. Serve with cornbread and garnish with cheese and sour cream if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the pasta until al dente. Drain and return to pot. Heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant and lightly browned. Add the chard and cook until wilted. Add the tomato packed with oil and the broth. Simmer until the broth is reduced and thickened. Add the pasta and the balsamic vinegar to the sauce and stir. Remove from the heat and stir in the pine nuts. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Transfer to an ovenproof dish and sprinkle with the Parmesan. Bake until the Parmesan is golden brown and the pasta is bubbly, about 10 minutes.

Add sesame oil to large saucepan over medium heat. Add chicken and brown on all sides for approximately 10 minutes. Add scallions and ginger to chicken and continue to cook for 10 minutes or more. Deglaze pan with soy sauce. Reduce heat to simmer and add brown sugar. Cook until mixture is reduced by half. Serve with rice or noodles or both.

Preheat oven to 400f. Bring water to boil. Cut brussels sprout halves crosswise into fourths. In large bowl mix sprouts with lemon juice, sugar and kosher salt. Place brussels sprouts into glass baking dish. Drizzle with butter and pour water over top. Bake until brussels sprouts are tender but firm to touch, about 35 minutes. Remove from oven. Stir brussels sprouts and add more lemon juice. Serve warm.

In a large pot, mix together the buttermilk and mustard. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat and cook for 10 minutes. Stir in the shrimp. Cook for 2 minutes or until shrimp are pink. Add the sugar and salt. Stir in the cucumber and green onions. Cook for 2 minutes. Ladle into cups and serve hot.

Make up dried apples by adding water to apples. Let sit for about an hour. Strain off water. Combine apples, orange juice, orange zest, cinnamon and sugar. Pour into pie crusts. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 35 minutes.

Combine oil, vinegar, mustard and soy sauce in a small mixing bowl. Stir in sesame oil, salt and pepper to taste. Set aside. Toss spinach with dressing just before serving to prevent wilting. Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds before serving.

Prepare graham cracker crusts according to package instructions. In a large bowl, combine lime juice and sugar. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Add gelatin. Stir until dissolved. Add condensed milk. Stir until gelatin is completely dissolved. Add green food coloring and stir until green color is achieved. Pour into graham cracker crusts. Chill until firm. Garnish with lime rind. Serve with whipping cream for dipping.

Melt butter and brown sugar together in a saucepan and stir until dissolved. Remove from heat and add the eggs one at a time, beating with a whisk to combine. Add the flour and cocoa to the egg mixture and stir until combined. Add the vanilla extract and stir again to combine. Pour the batter evenly into a greased 13x9-inch baking dish and sprinkle with walnuts. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of a brownie comes out clean.

Fill an 8-ounce glass half full of ice cubes. Pour in 6 ounces of boiling water. Stir to dissolve. Add fresh lavender and fresh lemon juice to the tea. Slowly stir in 4 ounces of fresh lemonade. Garnish with lemon slice. Serve hot or cold.

Cissy Bars: In a 9x13 baking dish melt margarine and brown sugar together and stir until well blended. Then mix in nuts and stir well. Next, place graham crackers in the baking dish and pour over the melted mixture and spread out evenly and smooth with spatula. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until lightly brown and crisp.

Wash carrots well under cold running water. Peel carrots. Cut carrots into large chunks. Peel onion. Cut onion into large chunks. Toss together carrots and onion. Dip carrots into corn starch. Dip carrots into eggs. Dip carrots into flour. Place carrots on cooking sheet. Spray with cooking spray. Cook carrots for about 15 minutes on medium heat. Stir carrots occasionally. Makes about 2 cups.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees. Coat a baking sheet with cooking sprayplace the breadcrumbs on a plate. Whisk the egg whites in a large bowl until frothyadd the cornstarch and whisk until combined. Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Dip the breasts into the egg whites, then coat them evenly with the breadcrumbs. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the breaded breasts and cook until browned about five minutes per side. Transfer the breasts to the baking sheetbake for about five minutes or until the internal temperature of the meat reaches 165 degrees Fahrenheit. Serve with the lemon wedges on the side.

Boil water to gelatin. In a bowl mix gelatin and boiling water together. Let cool. Fold in frozen lemonade concentrate. Whip the cream cheese to soft peaks. Fold in the whipped cream. Fold in the gelatin/water mixture. Add food coloring to the gelatin/water mixture. Chill for 30 minutes. Serve over ice. Yummmmmm.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Wash potatoes. Pat dry with paper towels. Toss potatoes with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Transfer potatoes to a large rimmed baking sheet. Toss to coat. Roast potatoes for about 45 minutes to 1 hour or until potatoes are tender.

Cream butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer. Add sugar and molasses. Beat until light and fluffy. Add egg. Stir in dry ingredients. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake until firm. (cookies will be soft when removed from the oven.) Cool.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add the orzo and cook until tender but not soft, about 8 minutes. Drain well. In a skillet over medium heat, melt the butter. Stir in the onion powder and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the lemon juice and zest and cook for 30 seconds. Add the spinach and cook until heated through. Stir in the orzo and the parmesan cheese until the cheese is melted. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve.

Prepare the Italian bread. Split in half lengthwise. Butter the bread slices and spread with a thin layer of sour cream and oregano. Layer with bacon. Add a layer of tomato slices. Layer with mozzarella and another layer of Italian bread. Place in a large baking dish. Cook at 375 for about 30 minutes. Enjoy!
Blend orange juice with pineapple juice. Add honey. Stir in ginger ale. Pour into a large punch bowl. Add rum. Add pineapple chunk and melon ball. Serve in a glass with a straw.

Saute onion in oil. Remove from oil and set aside. Mix eggs in a bowl with onion, soy sauce, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Mix in bok choy. Place a large pan on medium heat. Once pan is hot, add about a tablespoon of oil. Pour in egg mixture. Add bamboo shoots and shrimp. Stir eggs until cooked through. Serve over rice or noodles.

Pour egg whites in large bowl and stir in 1/4 cup of the sesame seeds. Place 1/4 of the sesame seed mixture on a plate. Dip one piece of chicken at a time in the egg white mixture then press into the sesame seed mixture to coat. Place on baking sheet. Repeat with remaining chicken pieces. Spray baking sheet lightly with nonstick spray. Place chicken in oven and bake for 20 minutes or until no longer pink. Remove from oven. Dip each piece of chicken in dijon mustard mixture. Coat with apricot preserves. Serve with dipping sauce. Serves 8. Makes 16 pieces.

In a large saucepan, combine broth, green onion, garlic clove and lemon juice. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for about 5 minutes or until liquid is reduced to about 2 cups. Remove from heat. Add avocado, yogurt and crabmeat to broth mixtureblend well with immersion blender or whisk. Pour into 4 soup bowls and garnish with fresh chopped parsley or cilantro.

Combine raspberry jello and boiling water in a large bowl. Stir until dissolved. Chill until ready to serve. Mix cream cheese and butter together until blended. Add the raspberries and stir until smooth. Place raspberries in a serving bowl. Cut pretzels in half and dip into melted butter. Dip pretzels into raspberry mixture and arrange on a serving platter. Chill until ready to serve. Just before serving, mix together Cool Whip and powdered sugar. Spread over pretzels. Serve with raspberries.
Bake at 375 for approx. 30 min. until bubbly.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In 2-quart casserole dish, combine cooked chicken, celery, soft breadcrumbs, parsley, salt, eggs, and 2 cups of the chicken broth. In large bowl, combine the remaining broth with the flourstir. Pour over chicken mixture. Cover casserole dish tightlybake 45 minutes or until heated through. Serve warm.

Melt the butter in a large pan over medium heat. Add the shallots and saute until soft, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and saute 1 minute more. Add the thyme and tarragon and saute 1 minute more, until fragrant. Add the white wine and deglaze the pan, scraping the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon. Add the mussels and cook just until they begin to open, about 3 minutes. Remove from the heat and transfer the mussels to a large serving bowl. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate until the mussels are fully open, about 15 minutes. Serve over the bread slices drizzled with the ale. Serve with the dipping sauce on the side.

Sauté chicken breasts in a skillet over medium heat for 3-4 minutes per side or until lightly browned and done. Dice chicken into small pieces and set aside. In a large saucepan, heat butter over low heat. Add Italian salad dressing mix, white wine and cream of mushroom soup. Stirring constantly over medium heat until mixture is hot but not boiling. Stir in cream cheese with chives until smooth. Add chicken, angel hair pasta, salt & pepper to taste. Covercook 2-3 minutes or until heated through. Serve immediately.

Mix sour cream, lemon juice, sugar, salt and crushed pineapple until smooth. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Scoop 1/3 cup of the sour cream mixture into each paper cup. Add 1 banana slice to each cup. Add 1 cherry. Sprinkle with pecans. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Serve. (You can use orange juice instead of lemon juice.)
